intro: Huernia pillansii, commonly known as the Zulu moon cactus, is a succulent native to South Africa. It features a swollen, fleshy stem with a distinctive, spiky appearance and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, cylindrical stems. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique morphology and resilience make it a fascinating subject for botanists and gardeners alike.
